Get an astonishing eagle‚Äôs eye view of the mesmerizing South Andaman Islands‚Äô coastline from the peak of Mount Harriet National Park. The ruins of a British summer house are an iconic landmark and natural attractions of the area. Take pictures! Mount Harriet National Park in Port Blair is a natural beauty with verdant landscapes for photography and would stand out in your feed. It‚Äôs also a great place to spot endemic birds of the tropical paradise.Mount Harriet National Park¬†offers panoramic aerial views of Port Blair City, and¬†Havelock Island. A great sightseeing place, Visiting Mount Harriet is one of the most famous things to do in Port Blair.

I recently visited Mount Manipur National Park with my in-laws to spend some quality family time, and it turned out to be a truly wonderful experience. The natural beauty of the place is breathtaking, and being surrounded by lush greenery and fresh air was refreshing. We had a great time exploring, relaxing, and simply enjoying each other's company in such a peaceful setting. I really enjoyed the entire visit ‚Äî it was the perfect way to unwind and create beautiful memories with family.

Excellent walking trails, secluded, peaceful tracks for hiking, bird calls, views of North Bay Island, forest cottages inside, up the mountain. Closes to visitors by 4.30pm. Camera charges additional to entry fee. Scenic views of the sea.

If you're visiting Port Blair, Mount Harriet National Park is a must-visit destination that offers an enchanting blend of lush greenery, serene ambiance, and breathtaking views. Conveniently accessible by frequent ferries, it is an enjoyable 8-kilometer ride or drive from the city center, making it a perfect getaway for nature enthusiasts and travelers seeking tranquility.

Entry and Permits

Before entering, you'll pass through a Forest Department gate where you need to provide your details and present a valid ID proof. The entry fee is nominal‚Äîjust ‚Çπ50 for visitors and ‚Çπ20 for two-wheelers. The staff issues a permit with a specified exit time, ensuring the preservation of the park‚Äôs pristine environment while regulating visitor activity.

The Experience

Once inside, you'll be greeted by a well-maintained park surrounded by dense tropical forests that are rich in biodiversity. Mount Harriet is part of the Andaman and Nicobar Islands' heritage, offering not just a slice of natural beauty but also historical significance‚Äîit once served as a summer retreat for British officials.

Attractions

The park offers several attractions:

Scenic Views: The panoramic vistas of the surrounding islands and the turquoise waters of the Bay of Bengal are mesmerizing. It‚Äôs a photographer's paradise and a peaceful spot for nature lovers.

Swings and Relaxation: Though not the adrenaline-pumping cliff swings you may imagine, the swings in the park provide a uniquely serene experience. As you sway gently, you feel immersed in the tranquility of nature, listening to birds chirping and the rustle of leaves in the breeze.

Trekking Trails: For the adventurous, the park has trails leading to Kala Patthar and Madhuban, offering opportunities to explore the lush flora and fauna.

Historical Significance: Don‚Äôt miss the view depicted on the ‚Çπ20 Indian currency note, which captures the natural beauty of this park.

Additional Information

The park's eco-friendly approach and the strict management of visitor activity enhance its charm. Be sure to respect the guidelines, keep the park clean, and enjoy the calm, refreshing atmosphere.

Final Thoughts

Mount Harriet National Park is not just a location; it‚Äôs an experience that rejuvenates your soul. The combination of natural beauty, well-maintained facilities, and the sheer peace it offers makes it one of the most memorable spots in the Andaman Islands. Whether you‚Äôre a nature lover, a history enthusiast, or just someone looking to escape the hustle and bustle, Mount Harriet National Park promises a fulfilling visit.

"Mount monipur National Park, Bambooflat, exceeded expectations! Lush forests, vibrant wildlife, and stunning vistas make this Andaman gem unforgettable. Well-maintained trails, expert guides, and tranquil waterfalls create a serene atmosphere. Perfect for trekking, birdwatching, and relaxation. Spot rare species, enjoy panoramic views, and unwind in nature. Friendly staff, clean facilities, and thoughtful signage add to the experience. A must-visit destination for nature enthusiasts and adventure seekers. Exceptional value for families, couples, and solo travelers alike!" 5/5 stars.

In the year 2021, Mt. Harriet National Park was renamed as The Manipur Parvat National Park which is one of the closest wilderness areas to Port Blair. The park was notified in the year 1996. The park contains some of the highest peaks in the Andaman group of Islands.
Some of the principal peaks are Mt.Koyob(459m), Mt. Next(425m), Mt. Warden(422m), Mt.Goodridge(376m), and Mt. Carpenter(346m).

Watch tower, Children park, Rest House and other tourist amenities. A well maintained nature trail connects kala Pathar view point with the rest house complex. There is a nature trail from Panighat to the park which is about 7.1 km long.
Eco-tourism opportunities available in the park.

placeMetadata.generatedDescription: Kalapani Museum in Port Blair is a one-of-a-kind private history museum housed in a three-story building. It showcases the history of the Andaman & Nicobar islands through an extensive collection of rare archival photographs, paintings, and artifacts from tribes and historical periods. The museum features miniature and life-size models, dioramas, and original documents from Colonial and Japanese eras. Visitors can also watch documentaries and films related to the island's history and the Indian Freedom Struggle.
placeMetadata.address: II, beside Susan's Roses, Garacharama, Sri Vijaya Puram, Andaman and Nicobar Islands 744105, India

üåø Wild Grass Resort ‚Äì In the Heart of Reserve Forest! üåø
‚≠êÔ∏è‚≠êÔ∏è‚≠êÔ∏è‚≠êÔ∏è‚≠êÔ∏è

If you‚Äôre someone who seeks peace away from the hustle of city life, Wild Grass Resort is the perfect escape. Tucked deep within the tranquil embrace of Reserve Forest, this resort is not just a place to stay‚Äîit‚Äôs an experience to feel.

From the moment you arrive, you're surrounded by untouched greenery, the sounds of birds, rustling leaves, and pure mountain air. It's nature in its rawest, most beautiful form. üå≤üçÉ

What makes this place truly special is the people behind it‚Äîthe Bath brothers, Karan and Aman. I‚Äôve had the pleasure of knowing them personally, and their genuine hospitality, warm nature, and hands-on involvement with every guest make a noticeable difference. They‚Äôre always around to help, guide, and make sure your stay is smooth and memorable.

üè° The Property
The resort is modest yet charming, with a rustic, earthy feel that perfectly complements its surroundings. The rooms are clean and cozy‚Äîideal for couples, families, or solo nature seekers. Don‚Äôt expect ultra-luxury here; instead, come ready to disconnect and recharge in a place that thrives on simplicity and serenity.

üçΩÔ∏è Food & Amenities
The food is available here. There‚Äôs a pool table for casual evenings and several scenic spots around. The view from the property is straight out of a postcard‚Äîrolling hills, dense greens, and a sky full of stars at night. ‚ú®

üë®‚Äçüë©‚Äçüëß‚Äçüë¶ Staff & Service
The staff (Anup) is incredibly polite, attentive, and helpful. You won‚Äôt find formal uniformed service here, but what you‚Äôll get instead is heartfelt hospitality that‚Äôs warm and real.

üìç Things to Keep in Mind
Yes, it‚Äôs a bit isolated. And yes, some facilities like network coverage (BSNL and Jio work better), ATMs, or convenience stores are limited. But that‚Äôs exactly what makes this place unique. It forces you to unplug, slow down, and connect‚Äîwith nature, with people, and with yourself.

Nearby- you can visit Chota balu and Bada balu beach. Beautiful beaches located in the vicinity. Also Mindapahad trek and scenic beach, biological park, Scuba Diving can be done. Best place for early morning birding as well. They can arrange few activities as well such as star gazing, birding, SCUBA diving, boat rides, fishing etc.

üåÑ Final Thoughts
Wild Grass Resort isn‚Äôt for everyone‚Äîbut for the right traveler, it‚Äôs everything. Whether you're a nature lover, a writer seeking inspiration, or just someone who wants to experience the calm that only a forest can offer‚Äîthis place has its own magic.

I totally loved it, and I‚Äôm sure I‚Äôll be back again. Highly recommended for anyone looking to experience nature in its most authentic form. üåøüíö

reviews.reviewText: Extremely beautiful and picturesque beach located far west of Port Blair. Very less crowds, so ample opportunity for photography. The sand is clean, the water is clear and the vibe is chill. Good place to catch the sunset too. A few vendors and shops are present at the beach.

It's a neat clean and pristine beach with silver white sand and crystal clear water on the shore followed by rich shades of blue as long as the eyes can see.
It's a very nice sunset location as well, long morning & evening walks on this beach are a must to recharge your batteries and enjoy the bliss of surrounding nature.
An underrated spot with less crowd & soothing vibes.

Andaman is known as it's crystal clear white sand sea beaches.
Wondoor also a popular sea beach with amazing view .
Near Port Blair this beach is very popular. Connectivity was too good bus private car all options available.

üåä Wandoor Beach ‚Äì A Hidden Gem Where the Sun Kisses the Ocean! üåÖ

If you‚Äôre looking for a tranquil escape in the Andamans that‚Äôs not overcrowded yet breathtakingly beautiful, Wandoor Beach is where your compass should point. Tucked away about 25 km from Port Blair, this beach is a perfect day trip destination that balances nature‚Äôs calm with raw beauty ‚Äî ideal for friends, photographers, sunset chasers, or anyone craving peace by the sea.

üß° Sunset Lovers, Rejoice!
The sunset at Wandoor is nothing short of magical. As the sun dips below the horizon, it paints the sky in shades of gold, orange, pink, and lavender ‚Äî a slow, cinematic transformation that makes you pause and just be present. Bring a mat, grab some chai, and watch nature‚Äôs show unravel ‚Äî you won‚Äôt regret it.

üë£ Best Explored with Friends and family
Wandoor is one of those places that‚Äôs made for laid-back laughs, casual conversations, and that carefree vibe you get when you're with your people. There‚Äôs ample space to sit, relax, take a stroll, or click that perfect group selfie with the glowing sky behind you.

‚ú® Clean, Calm, and Underrated
What struck me most is how clean and well-maintained the beach is ‚Äî a rare find these days. You‚Äôll find the shoreline tidy, the water clear, and a general sense of respect for nature. There are shaded seating spots, basic changing areas, and it never feels chaotic even during evenings.

üö´ Pro Tip: Don‚Äôt Litter.
It‚Äôs a beautiful place ‚Äî let‚Äôs keep it that way. Carry your own trash bags if you‚Äôre planning a mini picnic or snacks. There are bins, but doing our bit ensures Wandoor stays pristine for the next traveler.

üì∏ Insta-worthy Corners? Absolutely.
Driftwood, mangroves, shallow water, and dramatic skies ‚Äî photographers, take note! Whether you're into minimal frames or wide landscapes, there‚Äôs no shortage of subjects here.

üï∞Ô∏è Best Time to Visit?
Late afternoon is perfect. Reach by 3:30‚Äì4 PM, explore the area, click some pictures, and then settle in for the golden hour. It closes around 6:00‚Äì6:30 PM, so time your visit accordingly.

‚úÖ Quick Tips:

No water sports here ‚Äî it's more of a relaxation beach.

There‚Äôs a jetty nearby for boats to Jolly Buoy Island (if open).

Parking available

Don't swim here.

‚≠ê Final Verdict:
Wandoor Beach isn‚Äôt just a place ‚Äî it‚Äôs a mood. Clean, quiet, naturally stunning, and an absolute gem for sunset watchers. Whether you're a traveler or a local looking for a peaceful getaway with your gang ‚Äî Wandoor is worth every minute.

Let nature refresh you. And remember ‚Äî leave nothing but footprints. üåø

Excellent Peaceful clean beach with crystal clear water. Why to visit havelock island when you have so beautiful beach in port blair itself. Remote location but connectivity is there via also public buses also at regular intervals. Big parking space and few food stalls as well in evening.

Visited this beach on 19th March with my family to celebrate my sister‚Äôs birthday ‚Äî and honestly, it turned out to be the perfect spot for a relaxing day out! üéâüå¥

The beach is super calm, not very crowded, and has soft clean sand with clear water. Perfect for just sitting, chilling, and enjoying the view. We even brought some snacks and had a small celebration right by the shore üßÅüéÇ.

The sunset view here is absolutely beautiful üåÖ ‚Äî peaceful vibes all around. Not many shops nearby, so it's better to carry your own things. But that's what makes it more peaceful than other busy beaches.

‚úÖ If you're in Port Blair and want a quiet, family-friendly beach with natural beauty ‚Äî Wandoor is a solid choice!

Pros - view, peacefulness, location, sunset, blue water.
